variables.description: Allocation ID for the VPC Elastic IP address you want to associate with an                   Amazon EC2 instance in your VPC.
variables.name: AllocationId

variables.description: Elastic IP address that you want to associate with the Amazon EC2 instance specified                   by the InstanceId property. You can specify an existing Elastic IP                   address or a reference to an Elastic IP address allocated with a AWS::EC2::EIP resource.
variables.name: EIP
variables.required: Conditional. Required for Elastic IP addresses                   for use in EC2-Classic.

variables.description: Instance ID of the Amazon EC2 instance that you want to associate with the Elastic                   IP address specified by the EIP property.
variables.name: InstanceId

variables.description: The ID of the network interface to associate with the Elastic IP address (VPC                   only).
variables.name: NetworkInterfaceId

variables.description: The private IP address that you want to associate with the Elastic IP address.                   The private IP address is restricted to the primary and secondary private IP                   addresses that are associated with the network interface. By default, the private                   IP address that is associated with the EIP is the primary private IP address of                   the network interface.
variables.name: PrivateIpAddress
